DOC.brief_title: Empowering Latinas Obtain Breast Cancer Screenings
DOC.detailed_description: Latinas suffer disproportionately breast cancer relative non-Latina Whites ( NLWs ) , include late stage detection . While controversy breast cancer screening , non-adherence guideline-concordant screening continue major modifiable determinant breast cancer outcome disparity . Thus , increase participation breast cancer screen among Latinas , especially care corresponds clinical academic guideline , public health priority . Participatory approach popular method improve screen within group include approach 1 ) deliver education non-adherent Latinas 2 ) train community health advocate ( community health worker , breast cancer survivor ) engage breast health promotion . The second approach ( empowerment intervention ) concern train participant engage social outreach ( e.g. , conversation family friends breast health ) volunteering ( e.g. , help health fair , engage civic campaign breast cancer program ) . Patient activation volunteerism literature suggest empowerment intervention may 'added value ' participant deliver education term preventive health psychosocial factor practice . Relative education intervention , empowerment intervention may also affect woman 's network , may likely disseminate evidence-based breast health promotion among family friend . To date , little research compare intervention ' effect individual-level outcome use formal social network analysis examine network effect . The propose work add literature empirically compare two approach ( education versus empowerment ) three set outcomes : 1 ) woman 's screening , 2 ) woman 's self-efficacy , norm , support , knowledge ; 3 ) woman 's network ( measure egocentric analysis ) . I lead work benefit collective expertise resource mentor ( Drs . Ferrans , Mermelstein , Geller ) collaborator ( Dr. Schneider , The Resurrection Project , Metropolitan Chicago Breast Cancer Task Force , Sinai Urban Health Institute , University Illinois Cancer Center ) . Aim 1 intervention development accomplish continuous stakeholder engagement specifically meeting focus group bilingual , bicultural community advisory engagement board ( CEAB ) , UICC radiologists target participant ( non-adherent Latinas ) . We already begin process obtain formative data . After develop intervention material , pilot trial conduct area-level treatment control group design Chicago . Participants 150 Latinas history health volunteerism , residence one two targeted area , non-adherence US Preventive Services Task Force screen guideline . Aim 1 intervention evaluation involve analysis compare difference receipt medical record-confirmed screening within six month participate study . Aim 2 analysis compare intervention ' effect self-efficacy , norm , support , knowledge across three time point - pre-intervention , immediately post-intervention , six month post-intervention . Aim 3 social network analysis , specifically egocentric , compare intervention ' effect breast health , network size , network density well number peer refer study .
DOC.criteria: Age 5275 year old ; Identification Latina/Hispanic/Chicana female ; Residence Pilsen , Little Village , East Side South Chicago ; No history health volunteerism ; No history breast cancer ; Lack mammogram within last two year Not meet inclusion criterion ; Women exclude participated formative focus group
